questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -

Match the ACID terms to the appropriate descriptions.

To answer, drag the appropriate term from the column on the left to its description on the right. Each term may be used once, more than once or not at all.

NOTE: Each correct match is worth one point.

//IMG//

DRAG DROP -

Match the database normalization terms to the appropriate descriptions.

To answer, drag the appropriate term from the column on the left to its description on the right. Each term may be used once, more than once, or not at all.

NOTE: Each correct match is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
The answer is correct. 
Explanation from ChatGPT
Attribute - Get separated into individual columns
In a database, an attribute typically refers to a column in a table, which is where individual data elements of an entity are stored.
Entities - Get separated into individual tables
Entities in a database are typically represented as tables. Each table represents a specific type of object or concept within the system.
Foreign Keys - Link two related entities
A foreign key is a field (or collection of fields) in one table that uniquely identifies a row of another table. It is used to establish and enforce a link between the data in two tables.

Primary keys are the unique identifier for each record in a table.
Schema refers to the organization or structure of a database, including its tables, views, relationships, and other elements.
This is correct Answer. Entity = Table in a DB, Attribute = Column in a Table and Link to two related items in two tables = Foreign key.
Wouldn't it be both the Desktop app and the BI Service? Both services can create a dashboard.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/fundamentals/service-service-vs-desktop
The Venn diagram suggests Power BI Service
To create a dashboard, you can use only the Power BI service. The Desktop app is to create visualizations and build reports, not dashboards. And the mobile app is just to view the dash not create.

"The Power BI service is used to do things such as creating dashboards, creating and sharing apps, and analyzing and exploring your data to uncover business insights." 

see "https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/fundamentals/service-service-vs-desktop"
Correct Answer - Dashboards are a feature of the Power BI service, not Power BI Desktop
I think it's "only the Microsoft Power BI Desktop app"

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
I think the answer is NYN
The data governance is under data analysis and the data engineer does create pipelines.

From ChatGPT so "take it a pinch of salt " :
Data engineers identify data governance rules.
Answer: No
Explanation: Identifying data governance rules is typically the responsibility of data stewards or data governance teams, not data engineers. However, data engineers may implement these rules in the systems they develop.

Data engineers create data ingestion pipelines.
Answer: Yes
Explanation: Data engineers are responsible for designing, building, and managing data ingestion pipelines to move data from various sources to storage or processing systems.
